name: ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Acceptance Criteria - Steel bearing plates (top, bottom and tapered attachment plate) are to be manufactured to the requrements of the IFC Drawings and AS5100.4 and galvanised to AS/NZS4680:
Frequency - Where applicable, once, for each component
Acceptance Criteria - Product to be selected based on the following criteria:
i. dual component, thixotropic epoxy resin or adhesive
ii. CHARACTERISTIC COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF BEARING PEDESTAL MATERIAL TO BE 50 MPa MIN AT 28 DAYS. equal to or greater than substrate
iii. have no minimum thickness requirement
Frequency - Where applicable, once, for each product, prior to use
Acceptance Criteria - Elastomeric bearings are to be manufactured to the requirements of the IFC Drawings and AS5100.4.
Frequency - Where applicable, once, for each component
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
Acceptance Criteria - Re-check that the As-built dimensional tolerances comply with the requirements below:
○ Variation from grade across the width of individual pedestals shall not exceed 1 in 200
Acceptance Criteria - Bottom bearing plate to be dry-fit into the correct location and orientation as shown on the IFC Drawings.
○ Mix the epoxy bedding mortar as per the manufacturer's TDS and apply a 1mm thick layer (approximate) evenly to the full extent of the plate.
○ Bolt the plate to the pedestal to a torque setting of approximately 175Nm (60Nm hilti tds).
○ Record: The bearing plate ID onto the Red-line Drawings or Survey Report
Frequency - Where applicable, each bearing plate 4 days prior to loading
Acceptance Criteria - Place the elastomeric bearings to the survey marks to achieve compliance with the IFC Drawings and tolerances.
○ Record: The elastomeric bearing ID onto the Red-line Drawings or Survey Report
Frequency - Where applicable, each bearing location
Acceptance Criteria - Provide record of dimensional measurements to demonstrate concrete members comply with tolerances as per the table 610.462 as applicable to the element.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed in CAMs.
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
